data.name: I-WhyText
data.value:
As an underwriter and assembler, we create exclusive products for individuals and professionals. We fully manage them, thereby reducing your administrative workload.

We share the same values: customer service, speed, proximity, clarity, and a quality-to-premium ratio.

Comprehensive Coverage in Luxembourg, Belgium, and France:

With company accounts in these countries, we can place all your clients' risks: a second home in France, a car registered in a different country than your insured’s residence, exceptional assets worldwide, etc.

Thanks to our extensive network of insurance companies, we can also place special risks for your professional clients, which are often difficult to cover by "traditional" insurers.

data.name: AS-Text
data.value:
Why IBS Europe?

Backed by three generations of experience, we have reimagined the traditional model with our concept: Insurance Broker’s Solution®.

We DESIGN simple, high-performance, and transparent contracts.

We FIND insurers capable of covering the risks we have identified.

We ISSUE AND MANAGE both contracts and claims.

We PROVIDE a modern and high-quality solution for both brokers and policyholders.

Our commitments:

  • Adding value at every stage.
  • Designing proven contracts tailored to policyholders' needs.
  • Selecting reliable insurers to cover financial risks.
  • Managing in an open and modern way.
  • Presenting clear and transparent contracts.
  • Handling claims quickly, fairly, and efficiently.
  • A "Client-first" mindset at the heart of every action.
  • Commitment to responding within 8 working hours.
  • Offering highly personalised solutions.
  • Providing the best value for money by eliminating redundancies.

Why Luxembourg?

  • Because we believe the market is becoming increasingly international, even for individuals.
  • Because Luxembourg is a legitimate hub for financial and insurance services under the freedom to provide services.
  • Because today, a back-office operates in the same way, regardless of its geographical location.

Our goal:

To allow you to focus on your client relationships by providing exclusive and modern products while taking care of most of your administrative tasks.

data.name: M-Text
data.value:
Website Publisher

Manuel THIRY

Phone: +32 492/80.22.08
Email: thiry.manuel@hotmail.com

Legal Notice

1. Legal Information

This website is published by Insurance Broker's Solution Europe, a Public Limited Company (Société Anonyme), registered with the Trade and Companies Register (RCS) under number B108838, with its registered office at Route de Luxembourg 68, 4972 Dippach, Grand Duchy of Luxembourg .

2. Authorisation and Regulation

Insurance Broker's Solution Europe is an insurance broker authorised by the Commissariat aux Assurances (CAA) of Luxembourg under affiliation number 2005CM014.

3. Publication Director

The website’s publication director is Gael de Miomandre, acting as Managing Director of Insurance Broker's Solution Europe.

4. Website Hosting

The website is hosted by OVHcloud, with its registered office at 2 rue Kellermann - 59100 Roubaix - France , and can be contacted at +33 9 72 10 10 07.

5. Intellectual Property

All content on this website, including but not limited to text, graphics, images, logos, icons, videos, and their arrangement, is the exclusive property of Insurance Broker's Solution Europe or their respective authors, and is protected by applicable intellectual property laws.

6. Liability

The content of this website is provided for informational purposes only. The details of the insurance products offered are outlined to inform you. Insurance Broker's Solution Europe does not guarantee the absolute accuracy of the information and disclaims any liability for errors or omissions. The website does not imply any online subscription or contractual commitment by the user.

Documents available for download, such as subscription questionnaires, are for informational purposes only and do not constitute a contract offer. Any insurance subscription or request will be finalised after direct communication with our advisors.

7. Applicable Law and Jurisdiction

This legal notice is governed by Luxembourg law. Any dispute related to the use of this website shall be subject to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of Luxembourg.

8. Use of Cookies

This website uses only cookies that are strictly necessary for its proper functioning (e.g., session management, security). No personal data is collected or shared with third parties. No advertising or tracking cookies are used.

data.name: Po-Text
data.value:
Privacy Policy

1. Introduction

Protecting your personal data is a priority for Insurance Broker's Solution Europe. This privacy policy informs you about how we collect, use, and protect your personal data in accordance with the requirements of the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and applicable Luxembourg legislation.

2. Data Controller

The data controller responsible for personal data collected on this website is Insurance Broker's Solution Europe, a public limited company registered under number B108838, with its registered office at Route de Luxembourg 68, 4972 Dippach, Grand Duchy of Luxembourg .

3. Types of Data Collected

We only collect personal data that you voluntarily provide when you:

  • Fill in a contact form with your details (name, surname, email address, phone number) and your request.
  • Download documents or subscription questionnaires, although these do not constitute a final subscription.
4. Purposes of Processing

The personal data collected is used for the following purposes:

  • Responding to your contact requests.
  • Providing you with information about the insurance products we offer.
  • Allowing you to download subscription questionnaires for informational purposes.
  • Fulfilling our legal, regulatory, professional, and/or contractual obligations.
5. Legal Bases for Processing

The processing of your data is based on the following legal grounds:

  • Consent: We obtain your consent when you fill in a contact form or request information.
  • Performance of a contract: Processing may be necessary to respond to a specific user request, although no contract is concluded via the website.
  • Regulatory obligation: When we are required to process your personal data to comply with a legal obligation or provide information to a public authority, tax authority, regulatory authority, or judicial authority.
  • Legitimate interests: We process your personal data if it is in our legitimate interest to do so in order to manage our business effectively in compliance with regulations, provided that this interest does not override your own interests.
6. Data Sharing

We only share your personal data with third parties in the following cases:

  • With trusted service providers who assist us in managing contact requests (e.g., email service providers).
  • If required to comply with a legal obligation.

Your data will not be sold or exchanged for commercial purposes.

7. Data Retention Period

We retain your personal data only for the time necessary to respond to your request or to meet legal obligations, after which it is securely deleted.

8. Your Rights

Under the GDPR, you have the following rights regarding your personal data:

  • Right of access: You can request a copy of the data we hold about you.
  • Right to rectification: You can request the correction of incorrect or incomplete data.
  • Right to erasure: You can request the deletion of your personal data, subject to certain conditions.
  • Right to restriction of processing: You can request the restriction of data processing in certain situations.
  • Right to data portability: You can request the transfer of your data to another service provider.
  • Right to object: You can object to the processing of your data for legitimate reasons.
  • Right to information: You can request confirmation of whether or not your personal data is being processed.
  • Right to lodge a complaint: You can lodge a complaint with the data protection supervisory authority.
  • Right to withdraw consent: If you have given your consent for data processing, you can withdraw it at any time without affecting the lawfulness of processing based on consent before its withdrawal.

To exercise these rights, you can contact us by email at info@ibseurope.com or by mail at our address mentioned above.

9. Data Security

We implement technical and organisational measures to protect your personal data against unauthorised access, disclosure, alteration, or destruction.

data.name: Claims-Text
data.value:
Complaints Policy

Introduction

At IBS Europe, customer satisfaction is a priority. That is why we have established a simple and transparent procedure to allow any customer to submit a complaint and receive a prompt and fair response.

What is a complaint?

A complaint is an expression of dissatisfaction made by a customer towards an insurance professional, particularly concerning:

  • the subscription, management, or cancellation of a contract,
  • a provided service,
  • received advice.

A request for information, clarification, or service is not considered a complaint.

How to submit a complaint?

You can send your complaint through one of the following means:

  • By email: info@ibseurope.com
  • By postal mail:
    IBS Europe
    Route de Luxembourg 68
    4972 Dippach, Luxembourg
Processing times
  • We acknowledge receipt of your complaint within 10 working days from its receipt.
  • A reasoned response will be sent to you no later than 30 working days.

If we are unable to respond within this timeframe, we will inform you of the reasons for the delay and the estimated response time.

Processing of personal data

The data collected in connection with your complaint is processed in accordance with our Privacy Policy and in compliance with the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR). It is retained only for the time necessary to handle the complaint and to fulfill our legal obligations.

In case of persistent disagreement

If, despite our efforts, the response provided does not satisfy you, you may contact the regulatory authority free of charge:

Commissariat aux Assurances (CAA)
Complaints Service
11, rue Robert Stümper, L-2557 Luxembourg
reclamation@caa.lu
www.caa.lu
